Joachim,

I've been looking into this bug a little.  Sounds frustrating.  Some thoughts:

1) "=kmmtester" is a correct value for the CONTAINER attribute, which stores a
Java model handle identifier, in which projects are preceded by "=".  Your
launch configuration appears well-formed. 

2) I was able to recreate the error log in comment 8 by putting a slash
character in the project name in the JUnit launch configuration page.  I've
opened a separate bug (bug 98072) with this issue.

I was not able to reproduce this problem in Eclipse 3.1 RC1, so I'm recommending
we change this bug to status WORKSFORME.  Are you still seeing unrunnable launch
configurations?  If so, please log a second bug, with this information:

1) When you say in comment 1 "does not create a runnable launch config", what
does that mean?  Do you see an error message?  Where is it, and what is the text?
2) Is it possible that the problem lies in trying to launch a configuration when
the project has not yet been built?  Your steps to reproduce in comment 6
concern me that this is the case.

Thanks for any additional information you can provide.

I agree with David's assessment - closing
We should fix bug 98072

I verified that the problem is solved in 3.1RC2

Adding a new Junit runner now waits for the complete rebuild and if a previous
rebuild was canceled it is restarted first.
